info.title: OrderConfirmation
info.description:
Definition of the OrderConfirmation API

Introduction to Microsoft Supply Chain Object Model (Keystone)

Please Read

"Keystone" is a unified object model for defining entities and their properties in Supply Chain at Microsoft. These entities may be related to each other though References.

A Reference is used to link 2 objects together. For example, a Sales Order Line might contain a Reference to its corresponding Customer Purchase Order Line, and a Reference to a Serial Number.


How does keystone applies to JSON Response

Every key in JSON response maps to a keystone object or object property.

List of top level Keystone Objects in RMA response

  • ➮Routing: Routing describes the overall message being exchanged. It's like message header
    • Routing.Process.Type: The business process because of which this message is being sent. There can be several of these objects as a single message can fulfill different steps for different processes.
    • Routing.MessageId: Unique Message Exchange Id/BODID. This is identifier to track the message exchange across end to end system workflow. This is specific to the message but not to the message sending.
  • ➮Order: Order is self-explanatory. It's order in supply chain. It could be PurchaseOrder, SalesOrder, DeliveryOrder, ReturnOrder etc
  • ➮Shipment: Can represent an entire shipment or simply one leg of a shipment. Legs can either be ordered by a DateTime or by the order they appear within the message. DateTime will override order of appearance.
  • ➮ShipmentPackage: A ShipmentPackage represents a group of physical or logical packages that are referred to as a whole for at least some part of the shipment process
  • ➮Party: Party defines actors in supply chain.
  • ➮Product: This is Self-explanatory. It describes the product.
In addition to the above Objects, there are a few supplementary objects in keystone to establish relationships between objects, attach events, add non-standard properties etc. All of the top level keystone objects can have any number of these supplementary objects.

List of supplementary Keystone Objects

  • ➮Event: Event represents an event that happened to the parent object. E.g. Event.Type represents what happened. Event.When represents when it happened. E.g. Order creation Date, package shipped data etc.
  • ➮Property: Property represents a name & value pair. It is used to add any additional properties to parent object. These are additional to standard properties defines in the object. These are usually for informational purposes
    • Sometimes the value may contain object of property in value that is due to additional fields required to be associated with it like description.
  • ➮Reference: Establishes a link between the keystone entities via an Id. Every Shipment has a Sales order associated with it. So, sales order is associated with Shipment through Reference Object on Shipment.
  • ➮AlternateIdentity: This objects is used if there is another identity for this object. E.g. same product will have multiple SKUs: One from Microsoft and another from retailer

Authorizing calls to the API

The green "Authorize" button on this page allows you to specify values for the "Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key" and the "Authorization" headers. The correct values can be found on the developer portal, on the Open API Testing Console of the API. Make sure to select "Client Credentials" for the Service Authorization Server which will in turn populate the "Authorization" header value.

apiKeyHeader.description: Subscription Key associated with the developer
apiKeyHeader.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key

oauthWorkAroundHeader.description: Use this to specify the Bearer header directly (which typically comes from oauth)
oauthWorkAroundHeader.name: Authorization

Routing.description: Routing section  indicates info related to systems and unique id for tracking a particular transaction

Type.description: Identity of a specific message type  (e.g. Shipment, ConsumerOrder, etc.). This is going to be static value for OrderConfirmation API.

Version.description: Defined and Provided by Microsoft, Current version is "1.1"

MessageId.description: Unique Message Exchange Id/BODID. This is identifier to track the message exchange across end to end system workflow. This is specific to the message but not to the message sending.

PartyRole.description: This array will have only 2 values

Event.description: Represents when the message was created

Type.description: The business process because of which this message is being sent. There can be several of these objects as a single message can fulfill different steps for different processes.
Type.example: Order to Cash.Deliver and Invoice Goods.Manage Customer Delivery.Fulfill from DC.Delivery Order Created Order to Cash.Deliver and Invoice Goods.Manage Customer Delivery.Ship from DC Order to Cash.Deliver and Invoice Goods.Manage Customer Delivery.Fulfill from Supplier.Supplier Purchase Order Created Order to Cash.Deliver and Invoice Goods.Manage Customer Delivery.Ship from Supplier Order to Cash.Deliver and Invoice Goods and Services.Assemble to Order.Manage Customer Delivery.Ship from CM

Id.description: Process.Id is the CorrelationID which references instances of the business process

TestFlag.description: This a boolean flag indicates that the message is being sent for test purposes only.

Id.description: Sales or Purchase Order Number. To determine the party who created this order, refer to PartyRole[Type=Orderer].Party.Type

Property.description: Microsoft SAP Order type. As this is under Order.Type=SalesOrder, this field indicates type of Sales Order

Reference.description: Type should be PurchaseOrder. Use these fields as reference to other order numbers related to Order.Id

items.description: Datetime when the Order was created/changed/cancelled/updated from the initiator

Id.description: Sales or Purchase Order Line number
Usually this is the MicrosoftPartNumber of the product

Reference.description: Use these fields as reference to other order line numbers related to Order.Line.Id

Property.description: Indicates status of the Order Line such as Confirmed, BackOrdered or Partially confirmed.

IsBackOrderAuthorized.description: If present and true, back order is authorized.

Shipment.description: Can represent an entire shipment or simply one leg of a shipment. Legs can either be ordered by a DateTime or by the order they appear within the message. DateTime will override order of appearance.

Type.description: Identifies types of physical and logical shipments. Type= Order Indicates Header level Shipment Info.  Type= OrderLine Indicates Line level Shipment Info

Id.description: Usually the LoadId.  But could be MasterConveyanceLoadId or whatever is a natural key for the party creating the message.

Reference.description: Use these fields as reference to order numbers related to Shipment.Id

Property.description: Typically holds ShipAndPayTypeSAPCode, ShipViaSAPCode and IsOkToCombineShipmentsToSameLocation properties

ShipmentPartyRole.description: The value of this field can only be "Unknown" or "Carrier"
The value of this field can only be "Unknown", "ReceivingParty", or "SendingParty"

FreightPayCode.description: FreightPayCode is intermediary between the shipper and the carrier to receive, process, and pay invoices.

ServiceLevelCode.description: ServiceLevelCode in measurable terms, is the services a network service provider furnishes a customer within a given time period

items.description: This references all lower level packages within the shipment

Id.description: Generally indicates Plant id ( used for either ship to or Ship from) for internal purposes

ShipmentPackage.description: A ShipmentPackage represents a group of physical or logical packages that are referred to as a whole for at least some part of the shipment process

Id.description:
Serial numbers for the SKU mentioned in ShipmentPackage.Product.Id. Serial number length should be min of 12 digits.
And it should be numeric. Please note that alphanumeric values are not accepted. For example 002284554352

Item.description: Count of loops matches the ShipmentPackage.Quantity.Amount

Id.description:
Serial numbers for the SKU mentioned in ShipmentPackage.Product.Id. Serial number length should be min of 12 digits.
And it should be numeric. Please note that alphanumeric values are not accepted. For example 002284554352
This Id is a reference to Shipment.ShipmentPackageId.Id to detemine under which Shipment this package belongs too.

Type.description: Use these fields as reference to order numbers related to ShipmentPackage.Id

Event.description: This array can have 1 of 2 elements: a ScheduledDeliver or a ScheduledShip

Amount.description: Quantity of SKU confirmed/backorderd on ShipmentPackage.Event.When

MaximumPartialShipmentsCount.description: Maximum number of partial deliveries allowed per item - 0 and 1 both mean ship it all as one shipment

Id.description: Ususally the MicrosoftPartNumber of the product

Description.description: English text description of the product
Description.example: BOOK2 15IN I7/16/256 GPU SC EN US/C

Id.description: Customer Part number equilant to Microsoft Part Number

Classifier.description: This array contains 3 elements with the same schema but different names. The 3 possible names are MaterialGroup, ProductTypeSAPCode, and ItemClassificationSAPCode.

Name.description: Can only be one of MaterialGroup, ProductTypeSAPCode, or ItemClassificationSAPCode

Value.description: For MaterialGroup item, this is material class - One massive material that contains every full packaged product.  Currently a constant "FPP_PROGR". For ProductTypeSAPCode item, this is the SAP ProductType. For ItemClassificationSAPCode item, this is the SKU Classification Code.

Name.description: Only present if the product SKU is a launch SKU. Only possible value is "LaunchSKU"

Type.description: Type of the meaningful identity values in the Id field

Id.description: Type of the meaningful identity value associated with this party. Do not change it as it will be expected by downstream systems. DO NOT CHANGE - OWNED CTPFINOPS

nextLink.description: URL to query to get OrderConfirmations recorded after the last one that was already returned.

Id.description: It's the DUNSID, in case the party is Microsoft ouput is MicrosoftSupplyChain

Type.description:
Here are the expected party role types
Seller - seller of goods
Orderer - Order creator for Order.Id
DocumentCreator - Individual agent or system that created the order
In case the type is "SoldTo", the partyId is Sold To party SAP ID

Id.description: It's the DUNSID. In case the party is Microsoft ouput is MicrosoftSupplyChain
Advised SCAC Code of carrier or Ship From Party Id or Ship To Party Id

When.description: System generated datetime when the message is sent from the initiator.

Reason.description: Microsoft code for the reason for which the Order was rejected.

When.description: If type is "Ordered..." this is the date requested by the customer for the corresponding event. If type is "Estimated..." this is the date estimated by SAP

WhenEnd.description: This is similar to "When" but is used when an event has an end date that is different from its start date.

When.description: Estimated Ship or Delivery date for schedule line level quantity

WhenEnd.description: This is similar to "When" but is used when an event has an end date that is different from its start date.

Type.description: The type of price (Total or Net)

5 types of prices Surcharge/Discount/Tax/UnitPrice/CustomerExpected. The prices are divided into these 5 parts. For each part the amount, SAP code, decription is provided based on pricing conditions in the backend system

Prices.description: This is another array which can contain the same type of Prices items.

Classifier.description: Information about the price type in SAP

Value.description: Value of the SAP price type

ShipmentLocation.description: A location is an arbitrarily sized geographic location on earth that may be the origin or destination of a shipment. Geos are arranged in DAGs in master data. Sometimes, Geos may be derivable from Actors or Parties.

Id.description: Id which can be referenced with Party.Location.Id to be used as A location is an arbitrarily sized geographic location on earth that may be the origin or destination of a shipment. Geos are arranged in DAGs in master data. Sometimes, Geos may be derivable from Actors or Parties.

CurrencyCode.description: Code for country in whose currency the charges are specified

ExchangeRate.description: The exchange rate between amount and USD

DateTime.description: Format ( YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[Z]). This is the "Zulu time" ISO-8601 format.

TransportationMethodCodeEnum.description: Specifies how the shipment is being transported

get.description:
Gives details about a specific OrderConfirmation looked up either by CorrelationId or EntityId.

RMA API

The RMA API returns a lot of details about Order Confirmation. The following mapping defines the fields useful for RMA and where they can be found in the API response.

Note: This specifies RMA relevant fields and its JSONPath which is a way of describing and selecting elements in JSON objects. It allows us to specify how to find the different objects without ambiguity. You can learn more about JSONPath and its usage. It is not mandatory to use it in your implementation.

Field Location in response (JSONPath) Max Field Length
Message Id Routing.MessageId 36
Process Type Routing.Process.Type 200
Payload Created Date Routing.Event[?(@.Type=Created)].When 20
Sale Order Number Order[?(@.Type=SalesOrder)].Id 35
Sale Order Line Number Order[?(@.Type=SalesOrder)].Line.Id 6
SKU Order[?(@.Type=SalesOrder)].Line.Product.Id 35
Order Quantity Order[?(@.Type=SalesOrder)].Line.Quantity 15
Sales Order Created Date Order[?(@.Type=SalesOrder)].Event[?(@.Type=Created)].When 20
Customer PO Number

Find the PurchaseOrder of the Customer

(Order[?(@.Type=PurchaseOrder)].PartyRole[?(@.Type=Orderer)].Party[?(@.Type=Customer)]) and get that Order.Id		 35
Customer PO Line Identificators

Find the Line items of the PurchaseOrder of the Customer

(Order[?(@.Type=PurchaseOrder)].PartyRole[?(@.Type=Orderer)].Party[?(@.Type=Customer)]) and get Order.Line[*].Id		 6
Id for the party receiving goods Shipment.PartyRole[?(@.Type=SendingParty)] 17
Id for the party sending goods Shipment.PartyRole[?(@.Type=ReceivingParty)] 17
Confirmed Quantity ShipmentPackage[?(@.Type=OrderLineQuantity)].Quantity 15
Estimated Delivery Date

If Delivery Date and Ship Date are same, consider Delivery Date

ShipmentPackage[?(@.Type=OrderLineQuantity)].Event[?(@.Type=ScheduledDeliver)]		 20
Estimated Ship Date ShipmentPackage[?(@.Type=OrderLineQuantity)].Event[?(@.Type=ScheduledShip)] 20
Serial Number

This field is aplicable only in case of serialized goods returns

ShipmentPackage[?(@.Type=OrderLineQuantity)].Item.AlternateIdentity[?(@.Type=SerialNumber)].Id		 25
Cancellation reason code Order[?(@.Type=SalesOrder)].Line.Event[?(@.Type=Rejected)].Reason 2
Cancellation reason description Order[?(@.Type=SalesOrder)].Line.Event[?(@.Type=Rejected)].Property[?(@.Name=ReasonDescription)].Value 40

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: This parameter is used to find a specific OrderConfirmation. You can pass either CorrelationId or EntityId (e.g. "CorrelationId eq 'abc-123'" or "EntityId eq 'abc-456'").

200.description: Return the OrderConfirmation corresponding to the requested Correlation ID or Entity ID

400.description: This is what is returned from the server when the $filter parameter value is incorrectly formatted

401.description: This is what is returned from the server when authorization is invalid

get.description: This operation lists all OrderConfirmations that happened since a specific date by using the TimeStamp filter.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description:
'This parameter is used to list all OrderConfirmations since a given time.
To list all OrderConfirmations since a given time, pass the value "TimeStamp gt your-timestamp" where
your-timestamp is a ISO8601 "Zulu" format encoded timestamp (e.g. "2017-02-28T02:42:48.8964697Z"). This will
return the CorrelationIds of the OrderConfirmations that happened since then.'

204.description: The Api returns 204 and an empty response when there are no OrderConfirmations since the requested timestamp.

400.description: This is what is returned from the server when the $filter parameter value is incorrectly formatted

401.description: Response when subscription key or authorization values are incorrect

post.description: This method adds a new PO Ack to the System.
post.summary: OrderConfirmation - Add a new PO Ack (Keystone)
